intro: Spermacoce uniseta, commonly known as the single-stembed bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that are hairy on the underside. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
